column2: Project Role : Program/Project Management Lead Project Role Description : Lead business and technology outcomes for assigned program, project, or contracted service. Leverage standard tools, methodologies and processes to deliver, monitor, and control service level agreements.  Must have skills : Microsoft Dynamics CRM Functional Good to have skills : Functional Test Planning Minimum  5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Graduate or Post Graduate  Summary :As a Program/Project Management Lead for Microsoft Dynamics CRM Functional, you will be responsible for leading business and technology outcomes for assigned programs, projects, or contracted services. Your typical day will involve leveraging standard tools, methodologies, and processes to deliver, monitor, and control service level agreements.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the delivery of Microsoft Dynamics CRM Functional projects, ensuring successful outcomes for clients. Develop and maintain project plans, schedules, and budgets, ensuring adherence to timelines and budgets. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, testers, and business analysts, to ensure project success. Provide leadership and guidance to project team members, ensuring that project goals are met and that team members are motivated and engaged. Ensure that project risks are identified, assessed, and mitigated, and that project issues are identified, tracked, and resolved in a timely manner. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Strong functional knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Good To Have Skills:Experience with Functional Test Planning. Experience in leading Microsoft Dynamics CRM Functional projects. Strong project management skills, including the ability to develop and maintain project plans, schedules, and budgets. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify and mitigate project risks and issues. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in Microsoft Dynamics CRM Functional. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, engineering, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering successful Microsoft Dynamics CRM Functional projects. This position is based at our Mumbai office. Qualification Graduate or Post Graduate

column2: Project Role : Program/Project Management Lead Project Role Description : Lead business and technology outcomes for assigned program, project, or contracted service. Leverage standard tools, methodologies and processes to deliver, monitor, and control service level agreements.  Must have skills : Program Project Management Good to have skills : NA Minimum  5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : 15 years regular educational qualification "We Are:Messaging Collaboration and Productivity Ventures & Acquisitions Team. We are a team of digital workplace engineers that work to transition acquisitions into Accenture's IT email and collaboration services.You Are:Are you looking for new challenges in managing high-impact, high-profile projects navigating complex situations while building cross-functional relationships and bridge cultural gaps? Do you have strong communication, organizational, and technical problem-solving skills? If so, this is a great opportunity to be part of a new and growing team, to build strong skills in the latest areas of O365 and Google migration toolset and to work with great people in a continuous evolving environment.We are passionate about learning, innovation, and technology. We are positive, experimental, and adaptable. We use lean processes and strive to continuously improve everything that we do. We strive for a work environment that is happy, collaborative, and productive.The Work: Working with companies that are acquired by Accenture to onboard into Accenture standard messaging and collaboration services using a variety of tools and processes. Planning and coordinating migration activities between the acquired company, Accenture V&A ISIT team and Accenture MCP V&A Migration team. Work with technical team and business teams to coordinate activities for smooth transition. Interface between V&A ISIT team and MCP engineering, MCP data migration, MCP Google, MCP Solution Architecture, MCP SharePoint & Teams. Lead migration activities to prepare for and execute domain cutovers and data migration. Process improvement to migration processes and capabilities. Work with a global virtual team.Here's What You Need: Minimum 3 years' experience in project management skills, including work planning, status reporting, issue/risk management, communication to stakeholders, scheduling, and project closure. Experience with Office 365 services, particularly Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive for Business. Google GSuite preferred. Strong customer service skills and ability to interface with management and end users Ability to work in geographically dispersed teams Strong documentation and troubleshooting skills " Qualification 15 years regular educational qualification

column2: This role is part of the Product Management team within IDP Digital Campus, Chennai. This is a rewarding, high-impact role in a global business, with opportunity to create a major difference and deliver an outstanding outcome for our internal/external customers so expect to innovate and be challenged. .       You will lead a capable team of Product Owners, assisting in capability growth through practical hands-on practice leadership in Agile. Your team is critical to your success, and you will garnish deep understanding of our internal/external customer needs.     Practice: Developing the practice of product owners through strategic direction, implementing industry best practice, and building continuous improvement cultures.      Take responsibility for stakeholder escalations and act as a point of escalation both in and out of hours as required. Drive continuous improvement.     People: Strong supporter of investing in peoples development to reach their potential. Building highly engaged performing product team, through understanding motivation, capability uplift, leadership and guidance.     Hosting community of practice for product teams across globe, sharing and re-applying skills and knowledge and bringing in best practice. Act as a change lead for PO s with regards to Agile WOW initiatives and other projects, as and when required.      Customer: Believer that roles only exist to serve a customer. Ensuring stakeholder management underpins everything we do, through understanding stakeholders, establishing good relationships and regularly seeking 360 feedback.      Work with the Project Sponsor, Key Stakeholders like Customer Ambassadors, Product Manager to define the roadmap for any given product.      To drive a culture of Customer first within the IDP technology team ensuring all staff consider the customer as the centre of all their activities .      Delivery: the successful candidate will manage DC product owners across projects and BAU enhancements, typically to deliver a specific product or transformation via a multi-disciplinary squads.      You ll be adept at delivering complex digital projects, breaking down barriers for your team and both planning at a higher level and getting into the detail to make things happen when needed.      Deliver projects and products using the appropriate methodology, learning & iterating frequently     Reporting: Contribute to operational, project and management level reporting.             Key Performance Area         Key Responsibility         Practice Management         Establish and manage the Product Practice     Ensure alignment with organisational strategy     Provide tooling & support     Assess performance, capability and quality     Regular reporting of team metrics to Senior Leaders         Embed Data Insights and customer insights         The customer is at the centre of everything we do. This role will leverage our customer co-design way of working and will connect customer needs to the portfolio of digital and physical tools that we offer. Our customer experience is measured on NPS outcomes and counsellor adoption rates of the tools our network uses to ensure we are efficient, relevant, connected and valued by our customers. (internal and external)     Capture and use data and insights to deliver better experiences, larger user groups or stronger productivity of our counsellors. column2: To spearhead the design process through all project phases as per client needs and standard codes, were seeking a Structural Specialist to join our building team in India. With over 120 professionals in India together with our global team of experts, we work alongside our customers on the world s most prestigious building and industrial projects. Weve contributed to notable projects like Copenhagen airport - Terminal 3 Airside extension and LEGO Manufacturing Facility plant in US, Vietnam, and China , highlighting our commitment to excellence in buildings and addressing the growing demands of our international business. As a Specialist, you will report to the Head of Building Structures, in India.         Your responsibilities will be to:         Develop feasibility/concept studies, prepare project design basis, and detailed design of Structural Engineering services in buildings and industrial projects as per client requirement.         Lead the entire design process involved in all design phases of the project, as per client requirements and in accordance with standard codes.         Lead team of engineers in analysis, design, and detailing of (medium/large size) concrete and steel structures and support junior staff in their career development.         Prepare an activity-time-resource plan for a project, maintain a log of the estimated time to complete the project, maintain a document control plan for the design deliverables, and ensure all project KPIs are met while making the final delivery.         Lead a team of engineers with advanced technical accuracy, monitor the delegated task, track the deadlines, identify the potential risk in design, and flag additional resource requirements to the Discipline Lead.         Do project coordination across disciplines and offer sustainable solutions on the interface comments/issues.         Review and certify the design deliverables made to counterpart.         Lead the internal meetings with counterpart discipline lead/PM, update the project progress, explain, and agree on major design decisions & disseminate information within the team.         Your skills. Our team. Together we design the future.       The first step to success in this role is that you are eager to collaborate with the people around you, whether they are colleagues, internal/external partners, or customers. Developing ties with others is something you do by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve.     Moreover, you will have:        Masters in Structural Engineering from a recognized Institute with a minimum of 10 years of experience in the design of RCC, steel and precast, and composite structures. Experience from an international engineering consultant firm will be an added advantage.         Proficiency in technical structural software like ROBOT/FEM design, ETABS, and SAFE. Knowledge of REVIT Structure and Navisworks will be preferred, but not essential.         Knowledge of International Codes related to Structural Engineering - EURO(EN), BS.EN, ACI, AISE Standards.         Proven track record of technical delivery of challenging structural engineering design projects both within the team and under own initiative         Good, project management skills with strong communication and willingness to learn new advancements in the design industry.         A sound understanding of Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel is essential.

column2: The Senior Specialist will report to the Manager of Housing Market Systems (India), and will need to be involved in working with the full range of market actors, private companies, public officials, civil society, consumers and households. This is the essence of TCIS contribution to the HFHI mission of ensuring that everyone has a decent place to live.     This role will need to safeguard and improve the efficiency and cost effectiveness of the TCIS capacity and capability, in order to facilitate accelerated growth and long-term success in advancing affordable housing solutions. With ambitious targets for further growth, this an exciting time to be joining a dynamic and collaborating environment and forward-thinking team.     This position will be based in Chennai, India. Candidates must be currently eligible to work in the country without sponsorship. The successful candidate will be offered a 2-year fixed term contract that is subject for renewal depending on the availability of funds, and with local country-based compensation package.     The work arrangement for this position is hybrid, and on a flextime schedule       Essential Duties and Responsibilities:                 Leads the housing market systems work in India, identifying and soliciting initiatives from various market actors in the housing value chain, building relationships and supporting facilitation activities.                 Provides project management on the delivery of market research and facilitation activities with private sector firms.                 Liaise with potential partners such as financial institutions, government agencies, construction companies, materials suppliers, etc. provides technical inputs on various products and services in the housing value chain. Assists in technical/commercial feasibility of various proposals and in structuring agreements with market actors.                 Leads monitoring and evaluation of the initiatives. Ensures data is periodically captured and analyzed, prepares reports. Facilitates internal learning activities based on feedback from the programs.                 Assists the country lead and sector lead in the research, strategy and planning of housing market systems program in India.                 Represents Habitat and TCIS as needed in industry gatherings and conferences as needed.                     Minimum Requirements:                   Education     - Bachelor s Degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, or related field. MBA is a plus   - Equivalent experience (if applicable)                   Years of Related Experience     Ten (10) years relevant experience in business, social entrepreneurship, international development, housing markets, or similar fields with progressively increasing responsibility                     Qualifications:         Capabilities:                 Entrepreneurial: works well in dynamic environments with limited resources.                 Persuasive: demonstrates ability to influence others, to work with outside actors and create collaborative projects.                 Agile: Prioritizes tasks and redirects work effort in response to new opportunities and changes in priorities.                 Strong inter-personal skills with the ability to develop and manage good relationships between the project, private sector, government and stakeholders.                 Quality and results-oriented: demonstrated attention to detail, highly organized and able to coordinate multiple activities simultaneously and within deadline.                   Technical Competencies:                 Technical proposal development: Capacity to write technical proposals for lead firms and/or contracts.                 Monitoring projects: understands projects monitoring and evaluation considerations and adds value to data received to make project improvements. Ability to monitor project implementation and manage project budgets.                 Communication and presentation skills in English (written and oral).                 Ability to converse in one or more South Indian languages, Tamil preferred.                           Preferred:                 Housing Construction/Engineering with understanding of affordable housing products, services for low-income groups particularly in disaster prone areas                 Strong networking skills including the demonstrated ability to engage with a range of different stakeholders from the private, public, and civil society sectors                 Innovative, growth mindset with a demonstrated sense of curiosity                 Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to approach a problem from multiple perspectives

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION:     The Production Manager is responsible for delivering the photo shoots. This will involve planning and executing the shootout of products with/without models. The successful candidate will be responsible for running the entire production of a sales event in a fast-paced and high-volume production environment (36-48 looks per day, 5-6 days per week). The production manager will also work closely with the IT and sourcing teams to meet the sales event schedules.          Responsibilities:    Arrange for and oversee 3-4 shoots per day   Coordinate and project manage the production of all photo shoots with efficiency and high quality   Manage the team of photographers, models, stylists and make-up artists   Create daily, weekly shoot plans and execute   Prepare and manage the entire production budget - optimize the cost of production per item produced   Work and coordinate with internal departments - IT and sourcing to produce high quality catalogues      REQUIREMENTS:    4-5 years relevant experience in production of still and video shoots   Love for fashion and strong project management experience   Demonstrated ability to contribute to a successful team environment   Keen attention to detail and experience in a deadline-driven workplace   Well-informed and experienced in luxury and retail catalogue production

column2: The WASH Specialist is responsible for running and supervising water, sanitation, and hygiene programs at all stages of the project management cycle      H/She will be responsible in leading the design, implementation and monitoring of WASH infrastructure interventions in India accomplishing program objectives and outcomes supporting Habitat for Humanity India (HFHB) and the regional Asia Pacific (AP) office      The purpose of the position is to support the improvement of access to sustainable WASH services and over all wellbeing of communities      In carrying out the work, the WASH professional will interact with other regional/national/headquarters staff, partner organizations for smooth and efficient delivery of WASH Programs      The Specialist ensures the overall success of the program by making sure the WASH team completes the defined activities while adhering to internal standards and that the program is completed on time, within budget and with acceptable quality      The WASH Specialist will be assuming 12 months assignment, dedicating 50% of the time under the direct supervision of the Sr      Program Director of HFH India and 50% under the Associate Director of Program Operations of HFH International Regional Office              Roles / Responsibilities        Provide technical leadership specific to WASH in DRR related activities in India50% Develop program plans, ensure its smooth implementation, and manage the partner/team s performance of project tasks and activities that may include, but are not limited to:          Construction or rehabilitation of water networks, gravity flow systems, wells or tube wells/boreholes Hygiene promotion and education according to India standards and norms Water quality testing and treatment      Water trucking and emergency water supply      Carrying out of assessments and post-implementation monitoring      Ensure appropriate design, construction and implementation of WASH hardware according to technical standards, as well as proper maintenance and use of WASH equipment      Advise on the technical design and implementation of field projects and provide assessments/reports of current efforts      Work with field staff to build consistency across each WASH intervention      Prepare and launch tender bidding procedure for contractor(s)      Supervise the engineering works related to WASH projects in the region      Inspect and certify all WASH infrastructure before contractors are paid, as necessary      Provide technical expertise related to the planned WASH infrastructure works carried out by projects      Ensure that expenditures and budgets are well-monitored and activities are implemented and completed within budget and on schedule      Ensure that all WASH infrastructure are within the acceptable sector and country standards      Ensure critical gaps in information, knowledge and understanding relating to water supply, water safety, water resource management and sanitation and hygiene promotion are recognized and addressed by stakeholders in the Habitat programs and partnersDraw a capacity building plan and build capacity of Habitat staff on WASH projects      Develop technical resources (e.gstrategic framework, standard operating procedures, manuals) to guide WASH Infrastructure interventions, drawing from international best practices, along with field specific observations      Develop clear infrastructure monitoring tools (e.gchecklists)      Support Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability and Learning (MEAL) team to conduct project monitoring and evaluation of WASH projects      Support the resource development team in resource mobilization      Document and manage the resources generated from WASH projects monitoring and evaluation for improving future program quality      Write WASH reports and submit to the project manager      Develop and ensure the use of appropriate techniques and materials for hygiene promotion and training      Manage in coordination with Sr, Program Director and the WASH program budget through the preparation of monthly forecasts and the monitoring of expenditure      Track the progress of activities, ensure the collecting of program indicators and provide on-time internal status reports and external donor reports      Identify and monitor risks, constraints or escalating issues, and inform the supervisor accordingly      Ensure that all data and information is updated, well organized and easily accessible; and that lessons learnt and best practice are capitalized      Coordinate with other technical departments to ensure a common approach, synergy and sharing of information      Ensure program efficiency and delivery in particular referring to cost effective and innovative solutions to accelerate trend of access with analysis of potential and sector environment      Represent Habitat for Humanity Bangladesh externally and collaborate/coordinate with local authorities, counterparts, partners and stakeholders      Analyze and report on the evolving humanitarian needs for Response and provide clear recommendations for interventions              Develop appropriate targeting criteria and mechanisms to ensure the needs of identified vulnerable groups are met.      Participate in the development of new proposals and the annual country strategy. Support in WASH DRR-related activities for the AP Regional office 50%      Ensure effective, practical, field operations plan which will facilitate country specific disaster responses are integrated and addressed in country DR Plans and country strategic and management plans.      Be the focal point for AP region DR3 community of practice for WASH with particular focus on collaboration and experience sharing between the low middle income countries (LMIC) with exemplary program practices being captured and shared with countries in the AP network.      Conduct assessments in support of conceptualization and design of disaster risk reduction interventions and/or disaster response intervention in collaboration with HQ, NOs, Branch Offices and Partners.      Provide direction, leadership and backstop support for the development, oversight and management of disaster risk reduction and response interventions in WASH interventions.      Support the design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of WASH programs related to disaster risk reduction and response programs.      Facilitate the communication and information sharing with HQ, other AOs, NOs, Branch Offices and Partners on disaster risk reduction and response program developments and monitoring in WASH.      Design, promote, facilitate and participate in disaster response (rapid response) training activities to increase the capacity of NOs, Branch Offices and Partners      Facilitate the development of DRR and mitigation intervention in collaboration program team in line with AP and country strategic business plan ensuring that it is within external standards in community resilience programming, with emphasis on international standards, such as SPHERE, IASC, Core Humanitarian Standards, ALNAP, etc.      With assistance from AP FOI focal point undertake donor mapping exercise identifying the most likely revenue sources and ways in which to engage with these.      Propose strategies, that enable Habitat to take a more strategic role in WASH-related disaster & climate mitigation, preparedness, and response.      Regional program quality monitoring Review assessment reports produced by DR3 Manager or Rapid Response Team to ensure it      contains adequate and accurate information and involve in proposal development and have close coordination with RD team.      Promote Regular monitoring and evaluation for the quality interventions against Habitat s WASH Standards in Disaster Response Projects. column2: The Climate Resilience programme at CEEW envisions a future where institutions, infrastructure, economies, and people are insulated from the risks of a changing climate.                          Backed by rigorous data analysis, integrated research, strategic communications and stakeholder engagement, our work is geared towards building climate resilience of people, infrastructure, ecosystems, and economies across different geographic scales by:                              Examining, identifying, assessing and predicting risks related to extreme climate events such as floods, droughts, and cyclones, variabilities in temperature and rainfall, and the compounding impacts of associated climate events at the national and sub-national levels.            Building tools to assess community resilience and adaptation capabilities and help climate-proof lives and livelihoods through data-driven research and strategic outreach.                        Job duties and accountabilities                                Strategy                          Support the Senior Programme Lead in the development of strate    gy and plan for    the    climate resilience programme at    CEEW                        Build a network of donors and partners and demonstrate buy-in from potential funders and    stakeholders (state governments, relevant central ministries/ agencies e.g., MoEFCC, NDMA) and play a key role in the fundraising process for the climate resilience programme                              Research                          Work with    the    Director, Research Coordination and Senior Researchers on specific research projects such as    sector-level risk assessments    under climate extremes, mainstreaming climate finance for mitigation and adaptation,    climate security-related issues    ,    cross-sectoral impacts of climate such as water,      agriculture, energy    efficiency, etc.                      Work closely with state governments to develop integrated energy, environment and water policies with climate at its centre                      Generate and pursue independent and original research ideas                        Develop plans for research projects and outline research procedures to be followed                        Extrapolate and verify data given by research analysts/programme    associates    , evaluate, organise and edit the data into comprehensive standard report forms                        Utilise internal and external databases and other research tools to create    value-added    research data                        Travel to project sites, when required, to conduct interviews or collect data for different research projects                                Project and people management                          Expand the    climate resilience    team by assisting in hiring the right set of people at a Research Analyst and Programme Associate level to drive the strategy and execute the plan                        Coordinate the work of Research Analysts and Programme Associates and guide them on different research projects                        Ensure that project deliverables are submitted on time                        Present results of research at national and international conferences, meetings, seminars and workshops and through personal contacts and networks                        Assist Research Fellows and other Senior Researchers with financial reporting and budgeting for specific projects                        Perform other duties occasionally, which are not included above but which would be consistent with the role                        Assist Research Fellows and other Senior Researchers in developing related projects for strengthening and expanding the existing programme of research, presenting research to key constituencies, advisory bodies, conferences & research institutes                      Selection Criteria                        Qualification                          Ph.D. or Masters in    C    limate    S    ciences    , Climate    change    , Climate studies, Natural    Resources Management,      Environmental Studies or any related field                        Work experience                        5-    10 years of experience in the    climate change domain, especially in climate change adaptation                      Prior experience    of    working on projects focussing on    building climate resilience    and    implementing adaptation strategies    , climate impacts on agriculture, water management and food security, and    conducting sectoral climate risk assessments    .                      Proven track record of publications in high-impact journals.                      Key skills                        Excellent project management skills.                    Excellent grasp of the English language and written and oral communication skills.                    Competent in using statistical and RS/GIS tools. Knowledge of languages such as R/Python will be an advantage. column1: Sustainable Habitat and Climate Action Specialist
column2: We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Sustainable Habitat and Climate Action Specialist. In this role, you will be responsible for conceptualising climate-aligned solutions for the built environment, including those linked to the neighborhood/ local community scale, by integrating multiple sources of knowledge such as climate science, environmental studies, building science, and engineering principles.     We expect you to be well versed in setting up transformative and transdisciplinary processes to imagine and deliver resilient and sustainable solutions. You will, for example, play a key role in conceptualising and implementing energy-centric, climate-aligned solutions at the building and neighbourhood-scale. In addition, we expect you to conceptualise climate-aligned solutions linked to various environmental services (e.g. water, sanitation, waste water, solid waste and drainage) including those linked to natural systems. You will also play a key role at the interface of environmental impact, buildings, and sustainable practices across multiple projects at IIHS.         Activities and Tasks       Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to, the following:     Conceptualising Sustainable Habitat Solutions:       Conducting comprehensive research and analysis of emerging evidence from multiple disciplines such as climate science, environmental studies, building science and engineering to identify various sustainable habitat options and barriers to, and enablers for, their widespread, sustained uptake;         Creating awareness on, and generating demand for, specific solutions at the building and neighbourhood-scale; these solutions would include those linked to energy-efficiency, water conservation, waste management, decentralised renewable energy systems, and nature-based and nature-oriented interventions, and, overall, to greenhouse gas emissions reduction and enhancement of local resilience to climate shocks and stresses;         Developing and supporting implementation of local interventions related to the above elements via extensive stakeholder engagement and by creating an accessible knowledge management system, which may include conceptualisation and implementation of an online market place;       Advise on Sustainable Household Practices:       Providing expertise on incorporating multiple sustainable household practices such as those linked to energy-efficient technologies, water & waste management techniques, enhanced renewable energy integration, and urban agriculture into building designs and neighbourhood plans;         Engaging, collaborating, and deliberating with multiple stakeholders such as architects, engineers, urban designers, builders, bankers, and civil servants to identify mechanisms and processes to enhance sustainable household practices, including exploring and setting up collaborative projects to explore the mainstreaming of sustainable design principles into those projects; these will be focused on creating prototypes for widespread implementation;         Engaging, collaborating, and deliberating with communities to help mainstream ideas of sustainable habitat lifestyle; these engagements may be focused on setting up dialogues and implementation support activities to mainstream multiple environmentally friendly principles and practices into the built environment landscape and may include elements of urban farming, waste management, energy efficiency, resource conservation, and biodiversity preservation and conservation;       Project Management:       Undertaking a continuous landscape analysis to identify and connect with climate solution providers; to begin with, this would be aimed at identifying the market-facing solutions landscape, which is expected to be leveraged to conceptualise and implement an online market place that brings together service providers and users;         Designing, coordinating, and overseeing project execution, ensuring adherence to contracts, reporting requirements, budgets, and timelines;       Knowledge Production:       Staying up-to-date with emerging trends, policies, programs, and regulations related to sustainable habitat practices, climate change mitigation, sustainable agriculture, urban farming and environmental conservation, and provide recommendations for integrating emerging technologies and best practices into projects;         Promoting knowledge management at the project and institutional scale, including preparing knowledge products on innovative approaches, good practices, and lessons learned;         Conceptualising and delivering measurement and other reporting protocols, that help monitor impact at local scale; this may include setting up assessment protocols that establish linkages between habitat scale intervention and sustainable development goals;       Capacity Building and Training:       Conceptualising and delivering capacity building and training programs related to sustainable habitat, including aspects of energy and water conservation issues, waste management, nature-based solutions, and sustainable household practices;         Contributing to developing appropriate training material, including, but not limited to, developing best practice cases linked to building energy performance improvement, resource (water, waste) management, incorporating nature-based interventions at the habitat scale, and biodiversity preservation and conservation;         Conceptualising, collaborating, and operationalising citizen science initiatives and protocols for community-based learning and monitoring systems;         Engaging with multiple education-centric and learning initiatives to identify avenues of engagement in order to mainstream sustainability education; these may include leveraging of existing IIHS projects and networks and establishing new networks and collaborations;       Others:       Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations and others;         Participating in all activities of Institution-Building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and traveling on IIHS work within or outside the country as and when needed.         Structure and Reporting        The specialist will report to the Senior Lead Practice and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and external individuals/ organisations, and students.         Person Specification       The ideal candidate should have:       A Master s Degree in Environmental Science/ Environmental Engineering/ Architecture/ Planning/ Development Studies/ Public Policy/ Sustainability/ Climate change or other climate and environment related fields;         A total of 8 10 years of professional experience at the built environment scale;         Strong knowledge of climate solutions, waste & water management, sustainable building practices, nature-based solutions; including being up-to-date with key policies, schemes, programs and sectoral changes and challenges;         Prior experience in knowledge management, capacity building and stakeholder management activities, including rich project management exposure;         Prior experience of working with communities at the city-scale;         Experience (desirable, not mandatory) around managing an online knowledge-focused and solution-centric support system and repository;         Excellent communication, relationship management, team-building and interpersonal skills; and an ability to work in inter-disciplinary, cross-sectoral teams;         Proficiency in English and Tamil and, preferably, in any other Indian language.
column11: Relationship management, Waste management, Environmental science, Renewable energy, Project management, Solid waste, ITES, Stakeholder management, Performance improvement, Team building

column2: The Consultant-MLE will report to the Senior Manager Research - Monitoring, Learning & Evaluation (MLE) and will be an integral part of Evidence Actions MLE team in India     As part of the team focused on the NDD & IFA supplementation program, the role involves contributing to the successful rollout of initiatives for the programs     As the program portfolio expands, the Consultant-MLE will contribute to exploring and implementing innovative ways of operating at scale with the use of technology     The position will conduct data analysis from various primary and secondary data sources and assist in the planning, implementation, and management of data collection and analysis of various research and surveys     The Consultant -MLE must have significant experience and strong analytical capabilities along with the ability to bring out insights and recommendations based on the analysis     The Consultant-MLE will be involved in other MLE initiatives and will be required to support delivering projects within an agreed timeline and high-quality outputs                 Roles & Responsibilities of the position         Work closely in collaboration with the Sr Manager Research-MLE to ensure effective implementation of MLE initiatives     Assist the MLE team in implementing program monitoring, including training and independent monitoring in the state     Develop documentation of all data management and analysis processes as required by the MLE team     Support in preparing analysis plans, report structures, and presentations, finalizing them in discussion with the MLE team     Conduct consistency checks on collected data, review agency-collected data, and provide feedback for error-free data, ensuring data quality for analysis     Develop data templates for maintaining high-quality databases of program and MLE indicators.     Prepare key insights and recommendations based on analysis and recommend improvements based on current practices     Ensure timely delivery of data output tables, detailed analysis, and reports; follow up with agencies and vendors for necessary data     Support in the compilation of reports (monthly, quarterly, and annual) for internal use and reporting to the global office and donors     Support in documenting lessons learned and potential best practices from field activities under MLE initiatives, coordinating with state teams and other stakeholders as needed     Assisting the team (as appropriate) in identifying literature and sources of data and reports     Perform other tasks as and when required and assigned     Willing to travel at least 10-20% of the time as assigned             Organizational Culture         Upholds the values of EAII Advisors.     Actively contributes to making an equitable workplace through inclusive practice and openness to different perspectives, cultures, and ideas.     Maintains behavior and conduct that uphold the highest standards for safeguarding, professionally and personally.         Essential         This position is open to postgraduates, with a background in any of these areas: statistics, econometrics, health economics, demography, operations research, public health, or related fields     At least 3-4 years of work experience in MLE-related areas. Work experience in reputed academic or research/survey organizations will be viewed favorably     Strong analytical skills and experience in using advanced levels of MS Excel are required     Significant experience in detailed high-level statistical analysis for large-scale surveys and writing reports for large-scale health surveys along with providing insights and recommendations     Prior experience with mobile or CAPI-based surveys is highly preferred     Fluency in written and spoken English and Hindi     People skills- the ability to work with multicultural and diverse teams with various levels of training and understanding     Ability to communicate effectively and assertively with people at all levels of the organization             Desirables          Work experience in reputed organizations will be viewed favorably     Knowledge of Stata/SPSS and/or programming experience will be viewed favorably     Strong knowledge of public health systems and experience with government systems will be an advantage     Strong interpersonal skills and ability to establish and maintain effective partnerships and working relations with people in a multicultural environment with sensitivity and respect for diversity     Proficiency in online data collection tools - ODK, Kobo Collect, or similar platforms      Strong communication skills (oral and written). Ability to communicate effectively with people at all levels of the organization     Highly motivated to achieve exceptional quality of data processes and results, and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously     Ability to Learn - Willingness to keep abreast of new development     Strong project management skills and strict adherence to deadlines             Disclaimer:    The duties and responsibilities described are not a comprehensive list and additional tasks may be assigned to the employee from time to time.       Compensation:    Competitive and commensurate with the individuals credentials, experience, and previous pay scale.           About EAII Advisors           EAII Advisors, Evidence Action's technical partner in India, supports the implementation of the school and Anganwadi-based National Deworming Day program, as well as iron and folic acid supplementation programs, across 11 states by providing technical assistance to applicable state ministries of health, education, and women and child development       Moving forward, EAII Advisors aims to expand its impact by collaborating with more state governments on these existing programs, as well as supporting new public health, water, & nutrition programming

column2: Project Role : Scrum Master Project Role Description : Acts as an enabler for the effective functioning of a software development team using Agile methodologies. Coaches and mentors the Scrum Team(s), removing barriers to successful implementation and enabling a continued focus on the task at hand. Facilitates scrum and agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives. Identifies and reports progress via appropriate metrics.  Must have skills : Scrum Good to have skills : NA Minimum  7.5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Minimum 15 years of full time education  Summary :As a Scrum Master, you will be responsible for enabling the effective functioning of a software development team using Agile methodologies. Your typical day will involve coaching and mentoring the Scrum Team(s), facilitating scrum and agile ceremonies, and identifying and reporting progress via appropriate metrics.  Roles & Responsibilities: Implement Project Management/Best Practices Keep all Parties on Track and Informed Introduce Agile Engineering Practices Coach Team Members Host Daily Stand-up Meetings Teach Scrum Practices and Principles Coach and mentor the Scrum Team(s), removing barriers to successful implementation and enabling a continued focus on the task at hand. Facilitate scrum and agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives. Identify and report progress via appropriate metrics, ensuring that the team is meeting its goals and objectives. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product owners, developers, and quality assurance, to ensure that the team is delivering high-quality software on time and within budget. Continuously improve the team's processes and practices, leveraging Agile methodologies and best practices to drive efficiency and effectiveness. Professional & Technical Skills: A Scrum Master demands a wide range of technical skills.  A successful Scrum Master must possess a strong understanding of Agile principles and the Scrum framework, proficiency in project management tools and software, knowledge of software development principles, problem-solving and analytical abilities, exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, and a commitment to continuous learning.  By acquiring and honing these technical skills, a Scrum Master can effectively guide and empower teams to achieve project success in an Agile environment. Must To Have Skills:Strong understanding of Scrum methodologies and Agile principles. Good To Have Skills:Experience with Agile project management tools such as JIRA or Trello. Effective communication, proficient team management, and engaging team building activities. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Proven track record of successfully leading Agile software development teams, with a minimum of 5 years of experience as a Scrum Master. Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution skills, with the ability to identify and address issues in a timely and effective manner. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 7.5 years of experience in Scrum methodologies and Agile principles. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, engineering, or a related field. This position is based at our Hyderabad office. Qualification Minimum 15 years of full time education
column11: team management, conflict resolution, scrum, agile principles, project management tools, trello, mentoring, agile ceremonies, budgeting, sprint review, sprint planning, coaching, agile, agile software development, jira, agile methodology

column2: One of BD s most profitable platforms Peripheral Intra-Venous Catheters (PIVC) with an annual revenue of $1B is looking for an energetic Project Lead who can help manage several projects to sustain, improve profitability, or ensure compliance to new standards and regulations for a large portfolio of products.        The successful candidate will be part of MDS PIVC PMO organization, reporting into the PIVC PMO Director. The position is located in BD s Technology Campus India site.      The Project Lead will have to manage the multi-functional activities of the projects, lead the cross functional team (R&D, Supply Chain, Marketing, Quality, MA, Regulatory etc.), and own and execute the Design Change Plan.      Educational Background      BS degree in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science & Engineering, Biomedical Engineering or a closely related engineering degree is required.      Professional Experience          At least 3 years relevant experience in product development or design change is needed.      Experience in planning work-streams, identifying risk and implementing action plans to optimize timelines and reduce execution risk.      Led the design control activities and implementation for their assigned project(s).      Creation of the project work breakdown structures, risk management, and design change plans.      Experience utilizing combination of analytical, statistical, computational, and empirical methods to gain deep understanding of design change impacts and      minimize overall development timelines.      Job Responsibilities          Provide the day-to-day job responsibilities for which the associate is responsible for the applicable position.      Effectively manage several compliance or design change projects along with the PIVC R&D /cross functional teams.      Collaborates with cross functional team to ensure timely delivery, review and approvals via regional registrations as well as other conflicting/dependent projects.      Responsible for the execution, quality, and results of the project and the effectiveness of the resulting product change in the market.      Interacts with functional managers and business leaders to communicate regarding critical project risks, questions or challenges.      Challenges core team members, functional leaders and business leaders regarding functional and cross functional strategies and approaches in order to improve project outcomes.      Analyzes design change situations and data with in-depth evaluation of multiple factors.      Influences solutions to business or technical problems.      Communicates and implements the scope and technical direction for the project team.      Understanding of project      management principles, theories & concepts.      Knowledge and Skills        a. Knowledge      Technical / Professional Trainings: Project Management training    Professional Certifications: Project Management Professional (PMP) (Preferred)    ISO 13485, ISO 14971, DFSS, MDR, FDA Design Controls (21 CFR 820)    Has a thorough understanding of the design change process and the design control activities required to be compliant to BD and global regulations.      b. Skills      Technical / Functional Skills:    o Six-sigma design and development    o Technical and project management skills and judgment to positively influence the direction of the project.    Behavioural Skills    o Looks for improvements in work processes by anticipating and dealing with problems and encouraging others to suggest innovations.    o Interacts with Program Managers and functional Managers on technical and project matters often requiring coordination between teams.    Soft Skills    o Ability to clearly communicate project status to management and drive cross-functional alignment.    Leadership Skills    o Able to create and influence novel thinking of the team.

column2: 1.Drive the achievement of strict financial controls in the program/project using best practise techniques and Telstra processes and procedures   2.Provide cost control guidance and insight to project/program manager, which includes the production and interpretation of timely and accurate financial results, budgets, forecasts and Estimates To Complete (ETC)   3.Provide cost control guidance and insights to internal suppliers which includes the production and interpretation of timely and accurate financial results, budgets, forecasts and ETC s   4.Preparation and review of monthly reports, monthly forecasts and annual budgets following close liaison with all stakeholders   5.Facilitate and participate in financial reviews and health checks as required.    6.Assist the LOB Finance Manager and Commercial Engineering Investment Lead in the overall financial management and accounting tasks conducted within the program.    7.Assist and provide quality assurance on financial information within business case submissions    8.Ensure there is a clear cost baseline established for all projects within scope.    9.Work in collaboration with Project/Program Managers to drive consistency of the project cost control approach to facilitate accuracy in project execution and reporting.      Generic Role Purpose     As a Technical Project Specialist, you play an integral role in achieving remarkable results on technical integration projects, delivered on time, to budget and that achieve the project objectives and business outcomes. You apply your technical expertise in ICT infrastructure, integration and Telstra products with your exceptional project delivery skills to drive projects to their success.     You have mastered the art of synthesising complex specifications and technical requirements into project plans and outcomes, and in doing so you directly shape the success of Telstra s projects and therefore our business.     Generic Responsibilities       As a Technical Project Specialist, you draw on your breath of knowledge and expertise in delivering technical projects and knowledge in Telstra s infrastructure, networks and products to deliver the following responsibilities:      Recognised as a technical project delivery professional in the areas of ICT infrastructure, networks and products     Apply skill in technology integrations and products delivery to impressively lead components of technical projects delivering on time, to budget, achieving the intended outcomes whilst visualising the benefits and risks of a range of potential solutions.      Provide input into project delivery requirements (eg timeframes, milestones, resources required), using terrific analytical thinking to anticipate, uncover and resolve issues, to directly contribute to the management of their delivery workstream. This includes reporting on deliverables against the project plan and escalating unanticipated variations for approval     Use a range of techniques and channels of communication and authentically engage with external partners and project team members to meet technical specifications and services, to ensure the execution of project requirements.      Synthesise technical products, architectures and challenges into language that non-technical team members and stakeholders understand, in order to drive project outcomes and communicate energetically and effectively across a diverse range of stakeholders     Synthesises industry knowledge and trends into thought-provoking insights and solutions to deliver improve business and customer outcomes.      Significantly contribute to identify innovative opportunities for continuous improvement within the project team to generate and support initiatives to improve operational effectiveness, customer experience and/or Telstra s profitability           Key Skills           Analytical Mindset with 5-10 years of experience     Should have a background in telecommunications or network engineering.     Should possess knowledge of how telecom/network projects operate,      along with a fair understanding of telecommunications and network      engineering concepts. column2: This is an opportunity to be a part of Bain s Energy and Natural Resources (ENR CoE) team, based out of the Gurugram office, and specifically support BAIN ENR practice on live cases, client development and proposal support       The ENR CoE consists of 45+ team members, organized into ~10 teams, working across various sectors such as oil and gas, power and utilities, chemicals, mining, fertilizers and agri-business As the ENR sector personnel, you will get exposed to case delivery and client development activities for our clients in Oil & Gas, Power & Utilities, Renewables, Wastewater Recycling, etc The primary objective of the sector professionals is to collaborate with practice/ case teams on the development and deployment of industry-specific analytical products and topic expertise to answer strategic questions of Bain s ENR clients       A PL works as a team member/contributor on BCN cases, driving the analysis on complex cases with some direction from a Project Leader and occasionally leading simple cases independently     In addition, they help mentor and coach Analysts by providing regular guidance/feedback     The expectation is to eventually provide significant direction and support to resolve complex issues and effectively manage client and team meetings              About you               The candidate should hold an MBA from a top-tier college with strong academic records, along with 3-5 years of experience in consulting for ENR clients, demonstrating extensive client/stakeholder management skills.        Good understanding of any of the ENR subsectors (oil & gas, power &utilities, Petrochemicals etc)     Candidates should possess excellent analytical, communication, problem solving and team player skills; ability to handle multiple tasks and work under pressure.     Should possess strong Excel Modeling and PowerPoint skills.     Basic to intermediate understanding of Python/ R             What you'll do             Project management responsibility that involves leading a team of Analysts and Associates to execute a case      Understand client needs and situations and adapt to case expectations; show ability to resolve discrete issues and/or drive consensus     Take responsibility for assigning work streams, monitoring and managing workload, and resolving overloads     Provide thought leadership and sound business judgment to drive research and analysis     Ensure timely, high quality, zero-defect research, analysis and output     Identify and apply the relevant analytical tools     Communicate data, knowledge and insight to the entire team; generate and screen realistic solutions based on sound reality checks and recommend actionable solutions     Effectively manage client and team meetings, and deliver effective presentation to the team, team leaders and managers/partners across the Bain system     Consistently seek and provide responsible feedback; recognize team s developmental needs and provide feedback towards their constant improvement and write reviews for appraisal     Assist on office management roles (eg, recruitment, training, etc)

able to turn complex technical messages into effective, succinct communications; ability to manage and influence stakeholders with competing priorities     Functional analysis skills to enable the capture and breakdown of well-formed requirements and priorities     Experience in project management tools dashboards is beneficial     Experience working in an Agile team is beneficial     Recognised Agile or Project management certifications are beneficial.     Experience in IT Service Management or Infrastructure projects     Experience in IT Service Management or Infrastructure projects

column2: Job Description  Lead, Support & Project manage projects of strategic importance. column2: The Sr Finance PM Specialist plays a crucial role in Finance Digital Operations organization, serving as the primary point of contact between business partners and analytics teams          You will be responsible for understanding business requirements, managing projects, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality analytics solutions, and fostering strong client relationships      You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, data engineers and finance analysts to deliver impactful analytics projects                     Key Tasks and Responsibilities:                Act as a trusted advisor to business partners, identifying opportunities for analytics-driven business improvements and providing actionable recommendations.          Leverage extensive finance knowledge to guide strategic project decisions, ensuring both relevance and significant value addition.          Build and nurture strong relationships with business stakeholders, understanding their business objectives, and providing strategic guidance on analytics solutions.          Effectively communicate complex analytical concepts and results to non-technical stakeholders.          Lead end-to-end project management, from scoping and planning to execution and delivery, ensuring projects are completed within scope, on time, and within budget.          Collaborate with business teams to define project requirements, set goals, and establish timelines.          Monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and proactively implement solutions to ensure successful project outcomes.          Ensure the delivery of high-quality analytics solutions that meet or exceed business expectations.          Review and validate analytical models, methodologies, and insights to ensure accuracy and relevance.          Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, finance analysts, and other team members to leverage technical expertise and deliver innovative analytics solutions.          Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in analytics.          Drive the testing and adoption of Generative AI tools, identifying areas where AI can effectively address business challenges.          Facilitate organizational communications to promote team achievements, share insights, and foster demand for analytics capabilities.                        Qualifications:              Bachelor s or Master s degree in a relevant field (Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics).          Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent certification.                      Experience:              Minimum of 5 years of experience in project management, particularly in analytics or data-driven projects.          Proven experience in managing multiple concurrent projects and ensuring their successful completion.                      Essential Skills:              Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.          Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.          Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.          Proficient in project management tools such as Jira and Smartsheet.          Familiarity with agile methodologies and their application in analytics projects.                      Desired Skills:              Deep understanding of finance and analytics, focusing on financial processes, regulations, and industry trends.          Customer-centric mindset with a commitment to understanding and meeting customer needs.

column1: ERP Tech and Data Scrum Master
column2: Project Management (PM) comprises project management for execution of cross-functional / geographical projects and programmes from initiation to completion      Covers determination of project / programme goals and support of business objectives and strategies      Ensures projects / programmes achieve their targets, keep their schedule, and maintain estimated cost, time, and quality within planned scope      Covers management of risks that affect the delivery of project outcomes              Subfamily Description          Internal Project Management (IPM) monitors and ensures projects for internal customers are delivered within agreed scope and are completed within budget, schedule, and quality standards      Covers implementation of process improvements to reduce development time and the assistance in the integration of complex business factors to develop and implement long-term strategic planning objectives                      You have:          7-10 years of experience as a scrum master and/or project manager, specifically with large-sized ERP programs in a multicultural environment and related internal controls      Experience in SAP S/4HANA, preferably in the reporting, data, and technical areas      Ability to effectively work and communicate with various audiences, including executives, peers, subordinates, technical and non-technical individuals      Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills      Experience working with Agile methodology      Proficient in English language      Self-confident with strong problem-solving and driving attitude          It would be nice if you also had:          Experience working in a DevOps environment          As part of the team, you will:          Lead a successful project planning, execution, and delivery of SAP S4/HANA, data, and surrounding applications as a strong ERP Technology and Data Scrum Master      Run multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring all requirements are gathered appropriately and deliverables are implemented on time, in quality and within budget      Manage changing priorities, multiple stakeholders, and suppliers, ensuring all parties involved are fully aware of project requirements, dependencies, milestones, and reporting tools      Engage closely with technical, reporting, and data project teams to analyze requirements and propose solutions that best fit the business needs      Manage program activities from initiation through planning, execution till closure      Modify/adapt program management plan for specific phases and projects      Prepare and lead RfQ processes with support of IT procurement and project team      Manage program resources and stakeholders relationships      Prepare project business case and ensure delivery within budget      Drive project costs-related activities and manage scope/schedule/budget creep-variance      Manage dependencies with other projects/programs and risks and issues, implementing corrective action plans      Present the project in governance forums and lead project regular meetings, reviews, and updates      Provide regular status reports and necessary project metrics to project and management teams      Maintain all relevant project documentation throughout the project life cycle

column2: To strengthen our IT Hub in Bangalore, we are looking for an    IT Product Owner    within our    Data Analytics Products and Services    (DAPS) product group for HR        In this position, you will work closely with IT, portfolio management and the HR function, internal & external development teams and business teams to specify, plan, design and develop, deploy and sustain high-performing HR analytics products at scale, in order to delight our business stakeholders and receivers                              What you will do                                Engage with Product Managers, Business Analysts and Architects of IT and ADI Streams for understanding the data and analytics needs of Nestl HR.                                  Partner with IT HR Stream and Corporate Function, Zone and markets to understand, analyse, translate, and document business requirements, pain points or opportunities.                                  Work with external partners, to design and build data and analytics products that deliver business value as efficiently as possible. You will deliver data models using a range of On-premise and Cloud toolsets, including SAPBW with HANA, new generation analytics platforms such as Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.                              You will create data and analytics products to support both standard reporting and more advanced analytics and machine learning use cases.                              You will work using waterfall and agile development methodologies, sometimes acting as Scrum Master, sometimes as Project lead, sometimes also being the lead solution designer.                              Be the custodian of the data models and flows within your scope, ensuring they remain compliant with policies around data security and solution design standards and best practices.                              You will work with external and internal colleagues to ensure training materials for the Product area are documented, as well as oversee the handover to deployment and sustain teams.                              Support the development and curation of data products in the data catalogue                              Support Product Managers/Product Group Managers through the full product lifecycle from new product initiation through to product retirement.                                    What will make you successful                              Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science, engineering, maths, finance, statistics or related discipline.                          Most likely you will come from a developer background, with 10+ years experience of building data assets and pipelines to serve analytics use cases.                          Whilst capable of performing hands-on development, you are keen to progress to leading and coaching others.                          You are keen to drive the work of developments teams or pods to be able to create solutions at scale.                          You have a track record of delivering analytics products at scale using SAP-BW, plus newer-generation data warehousing platforms e.g. Azure services and Snowflake.                          Ideally you have experience of using modern front-end analytics tools such as PowerBI and SAP SAC.                          Project Management experience would be desirable, working in dispersed teams in multiple locations and using both waterfall and agile/DevOps development methodologies.                          A good understanding of data engineering and architecture standards.                          Strong experience with effective communication at different levels in the organization and in English.                          An appreciation for data democratization and the F.A.I.R data principles.                          It is preferable to have some exposure to Portfolio management and financial KPIs and domain knowledge, particularly in relation to analytics.                            Be autonomous and proactive in proposing action plans, establishing relationships and engaging with different areas of the IT organization and the business.
column11: Computer science, Automation, data security, Project management, Machine learning, Agile, FMCG, IT operations, Portfolio management, Analytics

column2: As a Sr. Project Management Analyst, Marketing you will operate at the intersection of your team and the business. At the core you are expected to lead projects at category level or deliver to business objectives working alongside with your team. You will be helping further Target s strategies in playing a key role with great execution. You will be performing your role with minimal direction. You are expected to have a very good understanding of your functional area and design how creative work is accomplished by planning, organizing, managing and executing project plans/processes in addition to serving as the single point of contact & relationship manager for cross-functional teams (CFT).       As a Sr. Project Management Analyst, Marketing, you will:         Project manage creative campaigns throughout the creative strategy- execution lifecycle     Work closely with the Global stores marketing team to conceptualize, design and implement creative visual merchandising strategy     Deliver Projects in alignment to the organization s culture, products and imagery     Collaborate with the strategy teams to come up with, revise and present design ideas     Collaborate with the creative/design team comprising of Art Directors, Production Designers and Copywriters to ensure creative assets and quality are aligned to business needs     Creating and managing a content calendar and scheduling deadlines for Stores marketing teams     Managing and supervising stores marketing projects from beginning to end     Develop, maintain and update comprehensive project files as well as documentation like instructions, charts and project tracking              Act as the    single-point-of-contact    between US Client Management team & Target in India Marketing CFT teams (     Copywriting, Art Direction, User Experience, Quality Assurance, Accessibility, Media Operations, Media Trading & Optimization, & UI Engineering     ) and lead projects through the entire concept & activation phase     Review & analyse campaign requirements, assess campaign creative feasibility, conduct campaign/creative briefing meeting, facilitate ideation and brainstorming sessions     Be a thought and execution leader in    marketing/advertising    area and have the ability to drive the teams towards superior creative solutioning and campaign activation     Setup operational aspects of campaign & ensure that the creative fulfills guest experience & business objectives     Monitor & control the transition of campaign creatives / projects in each milestone     Delve into effectiveness of the campaign creatives and use data to influence future campaigns     Create & maintain appropriate documentation, prepare & share status reports / dashboards to appropriate stakeholders at set intervals     Lead creative project management process optimization, documentation of processes, standards and guidelines     Maintain deep digital expertise in assigned    businesses/categories       Lead /assist with special projects which could either be self-identified or assigned           About you:            Graduate in any discipline (preferably Communication Management) or equivalent     8+ years total experience with 4+ years as Visual store merchandiser/Brand Manager in Retail/Fashion/FMCG brands OR as Creative Project Manager/ in the Mainline/ Stores marketing/Visual merchandising industry with ability to manage and execute multiple projects     Proficiency of current visual merchandising trends and best practices     Deep analytical skills when creating the content calendar & campaign lifecycle for marketing campaigns across Stores.     Ability to manage and execute multiple projects at the same time     Exposure to multichannel marketing creative & communication     Exceptional communication skills across all settings, ability to tailor message as appropriate     Resourceful and able to work independently on filling in gaps of information         Able to demonstrate flexibility in approach and adapt to changing priorities and requirements     Has curiosity and drive for seeking and promoting new ideas, in combination with solid business judgment
